page.title: 03INFORMATION IN NASSINGTON.
page.content: The Church booklet called{The News of Nassington and Yarwell}was started by the vicar in December 1978.It is given to every home in the villages.A lady types it free of charge and the vicar prints it using an offset litho machine.It has between 16 and 36 pages and costs 600 pounds annually.The book- let is used by about 25 local groups. In our school there are 54 people and 52 of them have home telephones. Nassington has 2 public telephones,at Parkway and The Drove.There are 2 letter boxes,one at the Post Office and one on the Church wall which are emptied at 8.15am and 4.30pm by a post- man from Peterborough Sorting Office who drives a red van. He also delivers letters to homes in Nassington.School letters are sent home with pupils to inform parents and friends about events and give information about School.
